intro: Centaurium minimum, commonly known as lesser centaury, is a small flowering plant belonging to the family Gentianaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, blue-violet flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in moist, grassy habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically valuable component of its native ecosystems.
